intro: Sieruela schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian sieruela, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
